title: NEPRA concludes hearing into FCA for K-Electric
content:
ISLAMABAD, Jan 15 (APP):National Electric Power Regulatory Authority (NEPRA) on Wednesday concluded public hearing into public petition filed by K-Electric to cut power tariff under monthly fuel cost adjustment (FCA) for November 2024.
The hearing was presided over by Chairman NEPRA Waseem Mukhtar while other members Mathar Niaz Rana of Balochistan, member Sindh Rafique Ahmad Shaikh, Member Khyber-Pakhtunkhwa Engineer Maqsood Anwar Khan and member Punjab Amina Ahmed were also present.
The KE has sought Rs 4.98 per unit cut in the power tariff for the said period. The regulator also slashed 49 paisa per unit in FCA for KEâ€™s consumers in October 2024. The decrease would be applicable to all consumers except life line, pre-paid, Electric Vehicle Charging stations.
The NEPRA would announce its decision after reviewing all statistics.
